text.title: part13_John Reed on Orwell, God, self-destruction and the future of writing

hi.s: JR :

p.s: I do n't know if I have a most treasured , but I have a most precious possession .

hi.s: DS : Yeah , definitely .
JR :

p.s: A red chert scraper that I found walking along in the desert in New Mexico , about a year and a half ago .
With two kids I work really hard -- pretty much constantly .
But the thing about this is it has such an amazing energy , to hold it .

hi.s: DS : Mmm .
I feel that , yeah .
JR :

p.s: And the other -- it may be prehistoric , it may be several thousand years old --

hi.s: DS : What makes it a scraper ?
JR :

p.s: This is what 's interesting , to me -- after you killed the meat , this is what you would use to scrape the inside of the flesh off the fur .
Scraping the fat or the gristle off the top of the meat .
And it 's a reminder how much harder things were , you know ?
Any time I 'm feeling down on myself --

hi.s: DS : You could be scraping meat off bones .

text.p:
JR :
I could be scraping -- and it was really like that , you know ?
So -- there 's that .

hi.s: DS : I have treasured possessions , but I also have treasured memories .
I found a suicide in the woods when I was thirteen :
a kid my age , who was probably fourteen .
It 's a treasured memory in some ways , one that â€™s lasted my whole life , and it 's come back in a lot of ways .
On my MySpace profile , I make an allusion to that in my narrative .
I do n't think people actually read that .
I think that people look at pictures , and then they move on .
But that 's not really true .
I have been contacted by both that individual 's younger sister , who was eight when he killed himself , and the girlfriend he killed himself over .
Separately .

text.p:
JR :
Yeah , people do read the stuff on there .
People do .

JR :
The kids have made me a better writer .

hi.s: DS : Really ?

text.p:
JR :
Yeah , on the Shakespeare thing , I think part of what was holding me back from finishing it was -- because I had written the first half in 2003 -- that I had n't had kids .
I did n't understand the characters who had children .
I did n't really understand them .
And once I had had kids , I could approach them differently .
And it 's great when kids appear in your work .

hi.s: DS : Gives it depth and also maybe opens you up to a new audience .

text.p:
JR :
Yeah , I ca n't believe I did n't have any kids in my books .
I did have kids in my first novel , but not having kids or parents in your work is so weird .
It 's just such a weird lack .
You often see literary books that do n't have them .
